item.title: Bookish add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Here’s to books, the cheapest vacation you can buy." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Bookish add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Bookish add a quote by V.C. Andrews
item.description: "Life is like that - twenty minutes of misery for every two seconds of joy." -- V.C. Andrews

item.title: Bookish add a quote by V.C. Andrews
item.description: "What is normal? Normal is only ordinary; mediocre. Life belongs to the rare, exceptional individual who dares to be different." -- V.C. Andrews

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "Just remember, kid, you can quicker get back a million dollars that was stole than a word that you gave away." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Bookish add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "I will take the sun in my mouth and leap into the ripe air Alive with closed eyes to dash against darkness" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Julie Rugg
item.description: "People who say they don't have time to read simply don't want to." -- Julie Rugg

item.title: Bookish add a quote by John Piper
item.description: "Books don't change people; paragraphs do, Sometimes even sentences." -- John Piper

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Brad Kessler
item.description: "A book is like a key that fits into the tumbler of the soul. The two parts have to match in order for each to unlock. Then—<i>click</i>—a world opens." -- Brad Kessler

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Tiffany Madison
item.description: "If the novel is dead, I'm a necrophiliac." -- Tiffany Madison

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stanley Victor Paskavich
item.description: "Never judge a book by its "spine"." -- Stanley Victor Paskavich

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Tomie dePaola
item.description: "Reading is important, because if you can read, you can learn anything about everything and everything about anything." -- Tomie dePaola

item.title: Bookish add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Bookish add a quote by David Wong
item.description: "Something coming back from the dead was almost always bad news. Movies taught me that. For every one Jesus you get a million zombies." -- David Wong

item.title: Bookish add a quote by David Wong
item.description:
"She sat one of the fluffy cats in my lap and stuffed the other down my shirt. She turned and left.
'There,' said the large man. 'The kittens will make your sad go away." -- David Wong

item.title: Bookish add a quote by David Wong
item.description: "I know the Goliath Fucking Bird-Eating Spider can't fly because if it could, it would have a different name entirely. We would call it "sir" because it would be the dominant species on the planet. None of us would leave the house unless a Goliath Fucking Bird-Eating Spider said it was okay" -- David Wong

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are the perfect entertainment: no commercials, no batteries, hours of enjoyment for each dollar spent. What I wonder is why everybody doesn't carry a book around for those inevitable dead spots in life." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Both Rowling and Meyer, they’re speaking directly to young people. … The real difference is that Jo Rowling is a terrific writer and Stephenie Meyer can’t write worth a darn. She’s not very good." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bookish add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The scariest moment is always just before you start." -- Stephen King
